byline.contributor: Henrik Pryser Libell contributed reporting from Oslo.

abstract: Profile of Joachim Ronneberg, leader and only living member of World War II commando team that destroyed Norwegian plant vital to Nazi Germany's nuclear program; Ronneberg recalls 1943 mission, which he knew little about beforehand, and how much of outcome relied on luck; Ronneberg's accomplishments were not well known in his native Norway until recently.
lead_paragraph: Joachim Ronneberg of Norway says that just before his sabotage mission, he happened upon a tool that was crucial in destroying the Nazis’ supply of a fluid used to create nuclear weapons.

headline.main: WWII Hero Credits Luck and Chance in Foiling Hitler’s Nuclear Ambitions
headline.print_headline: Thwarting the Nazis With Daring and Chance

snippet: Joachim Ronneberg of Norway says that just before his sabotage mission, he happened upon a tool that was crucial in destroying the Nazis’ supply of a fluid used to create nuclear weapons.
